doc:
Jack Carson https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jack_Carson 0 John Elmer "Jack" Carson (October 27, 1910 – January 2, 1963) was a Canadian-born, American film actor. Though he was primarily used in supporting roles for comic relief, his work in films such as Mildred Pierce (1945) and Cat on a Hot Tin Roof (1958) displayed his mastery of "straight" dramatic actor roles as well. He worked for RKO and MGM (cast opposite Myrna Loy and William Powell in Love Crazy, 1941), but most of his memorable work was for Warner Bros. His trademark character was the wisecracking know-it-all, typically and inevitably undone by his own smug cockiness. John_Elmer_"_Jack_"_Carson ( October_27_,_1910 – January_2_,_1963 ) was a_Canadian-born , American_film_actor . Though he was_primarily_used in supporting roles for comic_relief , his_work in films such_as Mildred_Pierce_(_1945_)_and_Cat on a_Hot_Tin_Roof ( 1958_) displayed his_mastery of "_straight_"_dramatic_actor_roles as_well . He worked for RKO and MGM_( cast opposite_Myrna_Loy and William_Powell in Love_Crazy , 1941_) , but most of his_memorable_work was for Warner_Bros . His_trademark_character was the_wisecracking_know-it-all , typically and inevitably_undone by his_own_smug_cockiness .
